body.p: focuses mainly on Boot from SAN support over FCoE using QLogic FlexFabric adapters. Other issues addressed are listed below.

section.title: Fixed in this release

ul.li: Fixed: Issues with FCOE Boot from SAN support: (Failed to detect 3PAR disks for native-fcoe install boot from san), (Persistent device naming / FCoE indentification), (multipath does not return all paths for a four-path/LUN, 256 LUN FCoE/multipath setup), (The -B option on the multipathd is not being honoured.)
Fixed: kernel defect (Compute Node unreachable from the lifecycle manager node during run of hlm-status playbook).

Fixed: Race condition (If the login to the ISCSI target takes too long (more that a second) then when the vgchange -a y VG runs it cant find the VG because it has not finished the login process and then the files systems are not mounted.)

section.p: Fixed: Ironic OSSA (Vulnerability in OpenStack Ironic whereby Ironic node information including credentials is exposed to unauthenticated users.)
Fixed: Upgrade may fail - Can't load firmware file bnx2x/bnx2x-e2-7.12.30.0.fw. This issue, present in has been fixed in .

body.section: New in this release A new check has been added to the percona play to check for cluster partitioning. Information is available in the article Checking for Percona Cluster Partitioning
Known Issues in this release Problem: The ESX compute instance loses its ping to the instance private IP address after taking snapshot of ESX compute instances.
Workaround: Restart the particular OVSvAPP node of the host on which instance is launched.
Problem: Load balancer instances stuck in pending_delete or Error state require manual ceanup.
Workaround: See the article Deleting Load Balancer Instances Stuck in Pending_delete or Error State for instructions.
Problem: bm-reimage fails during the disk partitioning/filesystem creation phase on RedHat node that has been installed previously.
Workaround: Power cycle the node to restart the imaging process for this node.

section.title: Upgrading to
section.p: Whether you are upgrading from or , the core procedure is the same and is documented here. Note that you are required to reboot your nodes so that they will get the latest version of Linux for HPE Helion.
